content.question:
This question is a long free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question.

(12 points, suggested time 25 minutes)

A crane and box are both initially at rest. At time <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, the crane begins to drive forward at a constant speed of <math alttext="0.5 meter per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mfrac></math>, while also lifting the box with an upward acceleration of <math alttext="1 meter per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>. The box does not swing while being lifted by the crane.

(a) On the dot below, which represents the box, draw and label the forces (not components) that are exerted on the box during the scenario described above. Represent each force by a distinct arrow starting on, and pointing away from, the dot.

Note: Draw the relative lengths of all vectors to reflect the relative magnitudes of all the forces.

frqParts.text:
This question is a long free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question.

(12 points, suggested time 25 minutes)

A crane and box are both initially at rest. At time <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, the crane begins to drive forward at a constant speed of <math alttext="0.5 meter per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mfrac></math>, while also lifting the box with an upward acceleration of <math alttext="1 meter per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>. The box does not swing while being lifted by the crane.

(a) On the dot below, which represents the box, draw and label the forces (not components) that are exerted on the box during the scenario described above. Represent each force by a distinct arrow starting on, and pointing away from, the dot.

Note: Draw the relative lengths of all vectors to reflect the relative magnitudes of all the forces.

(b) On the grid below, sketch the shape of the path taken by the box as it is lifted by the crane as viewed by a stationary observer.

Justify the shape of the path you drew above.

(c) Assume that, at <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mtext> s</mtext></math>, the horizontal position of the box is <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and it has a vertical position of <math alttext="y equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Derive an equation that describes the vertical position <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math> of the box as a function of the horizontal position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> of the box.
(d) Does your equation from part (c) agree with your sketch in part (b)? Justify your response.

At time <math alttext="t equals t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the crane begins to accelerate forward, reaching a new constant velocity at time <math alttext="t equals t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The box accelerates upward during the entire time interval <math alttext="t sub 1 is less than t, is less than t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

(e) The dot below represents the box during the time interval <math alttext="t sub 1 is less than t, is less than t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. On the dot, draw an arrow indicating the direction of the net force exerted on the block during this interval. The arrow should start on, and point away from, the dot.

skill.text: 1.A: Create diagrams, tables, charts, or schematics to represent physical situations.
